title: AWS CodePipeline
description:
AWS CodePipeline

**Overview**

This is the AWS CodePipeline API Reference. This guide provides descriptions of the actions and data types for AWS CodePipeline. Some functionality for your pipeline is only configurable through the API. For additional information, see the [AWS CodePipeline User Guide](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/codepipeline/latest/userguide/welcome.html).

You can use the AWS CodePipeline API to work with pipelines, stages, actions, gates, and transitions, as described below.

_Pipelines_ are models of automated release processes. Each pipeline is uniquely named, and consists of actions, gates, and stages.

You can work with pipelines by calling:

*   CreatePipeline, which creates a uniquely-named pipeline.

*   DeletePipeline, which deletes the specified pipeline.

*   GetPipeline, which returns information about the pipeline structure and pipeline metadata, including the pipeline Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

*   GetPipelineExecution, which returns information about a specific execution of a pipeline.

*   GetPipelineState, which returns information about the current state of the stages and actions of a pipeline.

*   ListPipelines, which gets a summary of all of the pipelines associated with your account.

*   ListPipelineExecutions, which gets a summary of the most recent executions for a pipeline.

*   StartPipelineExecution, which runs the the most recent revision of an artifact through the pipeline.

*   UpdatePipeline, which updates a pipeline with edits or changes to the structure of the pipeline.

Pipelines include _stages_, which are logical groupings of gates and actions. Each stage contains one or more actions that must complete before the next stage begins. A stage will result in success or failure. If a stage fails, then the pipeline stops at that stage and will remain stopped until either a new version of an artifact appears in the source location, or a user takes action to re-run the most recent artifact through the pipeline. You can call GetPipelineState, which displays the status of a pipeline, including the status of stages in the pipeline, or GetPipeline, which returns the entire structure of the pipeline, including the stages of that pipeline. For more information about the structure of stages and actions, also refer to the [AWS CodePipeline Pipeline Structure Reference](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/codepipeline/latest/userguide/pipeline-structure.html).

Pipeline stages include _actions_, which are categorized into categories such as source or build actions performed within a stage of a pipeline. For example, you can use a source action to import artifacts into a pipeline from a source such as Amazon S3\. Like stages, you do not work with actions directly in most cases, but you do define and interact with actions when working with pipeline operations such as CreatePipeline and GetPipelineState.

Pipelines also include _transitions_, which allow the transition of artifacts from one stage to the next in a pipeline after the actions in one stage complete.

You can work with transitions by calling:

*   DisableStageTransition, which prevents artifacts from transitioning to the next stage in a pipeline.

*   EnableStageTransition, which enables transition of artifacts between stages in a pipeline.

**Using the API to integrate with AWS CodePipeline**

For third-party integrators or developers who want to create their own integrations with AWS CodePipeline, the expected sequence varies from the standard API user. In order to integrate with AWS CodePipeline, developers will need to work with the following items:

**Jobs**, which are instances of an action. For example, a job for a source action might import a revision of an artifact from a source.

You can work with jobs by calling:

*   AcknowledgeJob, which confirms whether a job worker has received the specified job,

*   GetJobDetails, which returns the details of a job,

*   PollForJobs, which determines whether there are any jobs to act upon,

*   PutJobFailureResult, which provides details of a job failure, and

*   PutJobSuccessResult, which provides details of a job success.

**Third party jobs**, which are instances of an action created by a partner action and integrated into AWS CodePipeline. Partner actions are created by members of the AWS Partner Network.

You can work with third party jobs by calling:

*   AcknowledgeThirdPartyJob, which confirms whether a job worker has received the specified job,

*   GetThirdPartyJobDetails, which requests the details of a job for a partner action,

*   PollForThirdPartyJobs, which determines whether there are any jobs to act upon,

*   PutThirdPartyJobFailureResult, which provides details of a job failure, and

*   PutThirdPartyJobSuccessResult, which provides details of a job success.

AWSSessionCredentials.description: Represents an AWS session credentials object. These credentials are temporary credentials that are issued by AWS Secure Token Service (STS). They can be used to access input and output artifacts in the Amazon S3 bucket used to store artifact for the pipeline in AWS CodePipeline.

accessKeyId.description: The access key for the session.

secretAccessKey.description: The secret access key for the session.

AWSSessionCredentials.title: AWSSessionCredentials

AcknowledgeJobInput.description: Represents the input of an AcknowledgeJob action.

jobId.description: The unique system-generated ID of the job for which you want to confirm receipt.

nonce.description: A system-generated random number that AWS CodePipeline uses to ensure that the job is being worked on by only one job worker. Get this number from the response of the PollForJobs request that returned this job.

AcknowledgeJobInput.title: AcknowledgeJobInput

AcknowledgeJobOutput.description: Represents the output of an AcknowledgeJob action.

status.description: Whether the job worker has received the specified job.

AcknowledgeJobOutput.title: AcknowledgeJobOutput

AcknowledgeThirdPartyJobInput.description: Represents the input of an AcknowledgeThirdPartyJob action.

clientToken.description: The clientToken portion of the clientId and clientToken pair used to verify that the calling entity is allowed access to the job and its details.

jobId.description: The unique system-generated ID of the job.

nonce.description: A system-generated random number that AWS CodePipeline uses to ensure that the job is being worked on by only one job worker. Get this number from the response to a GetThirdPartyJobDetails request.

AcknowledgeThirdPartyJobInput.title: AcknowledgeThirdPartyJobInput

AcknowledgeThirdPartyJobOutput.description: Represents the output of an AcknowledgeThirdPartyJob action.

status.description: The status information for the third party job, if any.

AcknowledgeThirdPartyJobOutput.title: AcknowledgeThirdPartyJobOutput

ActionConfiguration.description: Represents information about an action configuration.

configuration.description: The configuration data for the action.

ActionConfiguration.title: ActionConfiguration

ActionConfigurationProperty.description: Represents information about an action configuration property.

description.description: The description of the action configuration property that will be displayed to users.

key.description: Whether the configuration property is a key.

name.description: The name of the action configuration property.

queryable.description:
Indicates that the property will be used in conjunction with PollForJobs. When creating a custom action, an action can have up to one queryable property. If it has one, that property must be both required and not secret.

If you create a pipeline with a custom action type, and that custom action contains a queryable property, the value for that configuration property is subject to additional restrictions. The value must be less than or equal to twenty (20) characters. The value can contain only alphanumeric characters, underscores, and hyphens.

required.description: Whether the configuration property is a required value.

secret.description:
Whether the configuration property is secret. Secrets are hidden from all calls except for GetJobDetails, GetThirdPartyJobDetails, PollForJobs, and PollForThirdPartyJobs.

When updating a pipeline, passing * * * * * without changing any other values of the action will preserve the prior value of the secret.

type.description: The type of the configuration property.

ActionConfigurationProperty.title: ActionConfigurationProperty

ActionContext.description: Represents the context of an action within the stage of a pipeline to a job worker.

name.description: The name of the action within the context of a job.

ActionContext.title: ActionContext

ActionDeclaration.description: Represents information about an action declaration.

actionTypeId.description: The configuration information for the action type.

inputArtifacts.description: The name or ID of the artifact consumed by the action, such as a test or build artifact.

outputArtifacts.description: The name or ID of the result of the action declaration, such as a test or build artifact.

roleArn.description: The ARN of the IAM service role that will perform the declared action. This is assumed through the roleArn for the pipeline.

runOrder.description: The order in which actions are run.

ActionDeclaration.title: ActionDeclaration

ActionExecution.description: Represents information about the run of an action.

errorDetails.description: The details of an error returned by a URL external to AWS.

externalExecutionId.description: The external ID of the run of the action.

externalExecutionUrl.description: The URL of a resource external to AWS that will be used when running the action, for example an external repository URL.

lastStatusChange.description: The last status change of the action.

lastUpdatedBy.description: The ARN of the user who last changed the pipeline.

percentComplete.description: A percentage of completeness of the action as it runs.

status.description: The status of the action, or for a completed action, the last status of the action.

summary.description: A summary of the run of the action.

token.description: The system-generated token used to identify a unique approval request. The token for each open approval request can be obtained using the GetPipelineState command and is used to validate that the approval request corresponding to this token is still valid.

ActionExecution.title: ActionExecution

ActionNotFoundException.description: The specified action cannot be found.
ActionNotFoundException.title: ActionNotFoundException

ActionRevision.description: Represents information about the version (or revision) of an action.

created.description: The date and time when the most recent version of the action was created, in timestamp format.

revisionChangeId.description: The unique identifier of the change that set the state to this revision, for example a deployment ID or timestamp.

revisionId.description: The system-generated unique ID that identifies the revision number of the action.

ActionRevision.title: ActionRevision

ActionState.description: Represents information about the state of an action.

currentRevision.description: Represents information about the version (or revision) of an action.

entityUrl.description: A URL link for more information about the state of the action, such as a deployment group details page.

latestExecution.description: Represents information about the run of an action.

revisionUrl.description: A URL link for more information about the revision, such as a commit details page.

ActionState.title: ActionState

ActionType.description: Returns information about the details of an action type.

actionConfigurationProperties.description: The configuration properties for the action type.

id.description: Represents information about an action type.

inputArtifactDetails.description: The details of the input artifact for the action, such as its commit ID.

outputArtifactDetails.description: The details of the output artifact of the action, such as its commit ID.

settings.description: The settings for the action type.

ActionType.title: ActionType

ActionTypeId.description: Represents information about an action type.

category.description: A category defines what kind of action can be taken in the stage, and constrains the provider type for the action. Valid categories are limited to one of the values below.

owner.description: The creator of the action being called.

provider.description: The provider of the service being called by the action. Valid providers are determined by the action category. For example, an action in the Deploy category type might have a provider of AWS CodeDeploy, which would be specified as CodeDeploy.

version.description: A string that identifies the action type.

ActionTypeId.title: ActionTypeId

ActionTypeNotFoundException.description: The specified action type cannot be found.
ActionTypeNotFoundException.title: ActionTypeNotFoundException

ActionTypeSettings.description: Returns information about the settings for an action type.

entityUrlTemplate.description: The URL returned to the AWS CodePipeline console that provides a deep link to the resources of the external system, such as the configuration page for an AWS CodeDeploy deployment group. This link is provided as part of the action display within the pipeline.

executionUrlTemplate.description: The URL returned to the AWS CodePipeline console that contains a link to the top-level landing page for the external system, such as console page for AWS CodeDeploy. This link is shown on the pipeline view page in the AWS CodePipeline console and provides a link to the execution entity of the external action.

revisionUrlTemplate.description: The URL returned to the AWS CodePipeline console that contains a link to the page where customers can update or change the configuration of the external action.

thirdPartyConfigurationUrl.description: The URL of a sign-up page where users can sign up for an external service and perform initial configuration of the action provided by that service.

ActionTypeSettings.title: ActionTypeSettings

ApprovalAlreadyCompletedException.description: The approval action has already been approved or rejected.
ApprovalAlreadyCompletedException.title: ApprovalAlreadyCompletedException

ApprovalResult.description: Represents information about the result of an approval request.

status.description: The response submitted by a reviewer assigned to an approval action request.

summary.description: The summary of the current status of the approval request.

ApprovalResult.title: ApprovalResult

Artifact.description: Represents information about an artifact that will be worked upon by actions in the pipeline.

revision.description: The artifact's revision ID. Depending on the type of object, this could be a commit ID (GitHub) or a revision ID (Amazon S3).

Artifact.title: Artifact

ArtifactDetails.description: Returns information about the details of an artifact.

maximumCount.description: The maximum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

minimumCount.description: The minimum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

ArtifactDetails.title: ArtifactDetails

ArtifactLocation.description: Represents information about the location of an artifact.

s3Location.description: The Amazon S3 bucket that contains the artifact.

type.description: The type of artifact in the location.

ArtifactLocation.title: ArtifactLocation

ArtifactRevision.description: Represents revision details of an artifact.

created.description: The date and time when the most recent revision of the artifact was created, in timestamp format.

name.description: The name of an artifact. This name might be system-generated, such as "MyApp", or might be defined by the user when an action is created.

revisionChangeIdentifier.description: An additional identifier for a revision, such as a commit date or, for artifacts stored in Amazon S3 buckets, the ETag value.

revisionId.description: The revision ID of the artifact.

revisionSummary.description: Summary information about the most recent revision of the artifact. For GitHub and AWS CodeCommit repositories, the commit message. For Amazon S3 buckets or actions, the user-provided content of a codepipeline-artifact-revision-summary key specified in the object metadata.

revisionUrl.description: The commit ID for the artifact revision. For artifacts stored in GitHub or AWS CodeCommit repositories, the commit ID is linked to a commit details page.

ArtifactRevision.title: ArtifactRevision

ArtifactStore.description: The Amazon S3 bucket where artifacts are stored for the pipeline.

encryptionKey.description: The encryption key used to encrypt the data in the artifact store, such as an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key. If this is undefined, the default key for Amazon S3 is used.

location.description: The Amazon S3 bucket used for storing the artifacts for a pipeline. You can specify the name of an S3 bucket but not a folder within the bucket. A folder to contain the pipeline artifacts is created for you based on the name of the pipeline. You can use any Amazon S3 bucket in the same AWS Region as the pipeline to store your pipeline artifacts.

type.description: The type of the artifact store, such as S3.

ArtifactStore.title: ArtifactStore

CreateCustomActionTypeInput.description: Represents the input of a CreateCustomActionType operation.

category.description:
The category of the custom action, such as a build action or a test action.

Although Source and Approval are listed as valid values, they are not currently functional. These values are reserved for future use.

configurationProperties.description:
The configuration properties for the custom action.

You can refer to a name in the configuration properties of the custom action within the URL templates by following the format of {Config:name}, as long as the configuration property is both required and not secret. For more information, see Create a Custom Action for a Pipeline.

inputArtifactDetails.description: The details of the input artifact for the action, such as its commit ID.

outputArtifactDetails.description: The details of the output artifact of the action, such as its commit ID.

provider.description: The provider of the service used in the custom action, such as AWS CodeDeploy.

settings.description: Returns information about the settings for an action type.

version.description: The version identifier of the custom action.

CreateCustomActionTypeInput.title: CreateCustomActionTypeInput

CreateCustomActionTypeOutput.description: Represents the output of a CreateCustomActionType operation.

actionType.description: Returns information about the details of an action type.

CreateCustomActionTypeOutput.title: CreateCustomActionTypeOutput

CreatePipelineInput.description: Represents the input of a CreatePipeline action.

pipeline.description: Represents the structure of actions and stages to be performed in the pipeline.

CreatePipelineInput.title: CreatePipelineInput

CreatePipelineOutput.description: Represents the output of a CreatePipeline action.

pipeline.description: Represents the structure of actions and stages to be performed in the pipeline.

CreatePipelineOutput.title: CreatePipelineOutput

CurrentRevision.description: Represents information about a current revision.

changeIdentifier.description: The change identifier for the current revision.

created.description: The date and time when the most recent revision of the artifact was created, in timestamp format.

revision.description: The revision ID of the current version of an artifact.

revisionSummary.description: The summary of the most recent revision of the artifact.

CurrentRevision.title: CurrentRevision

DeleteCustomActionTypeInput.description: Represents the input of a DeleteCustomActionType operation. The custom action will be marked as deleted.

category.description: The category of the custom action that you want to delete, such as source or deploy.

provider.description: The provider of the service used in the custom action, such as AWS CodeDeploy.

version.description: The version of the custom action to delete.

DeleteCustomActionTypeInput.title: DeleteCustomActionTypeInput

DeletePipelineInput.description: Represents the input of a DeletePipeline action.

name.description: The name of the pipeline to be deleted.

DeletePipelineInput.title: DeletePipelineInput

DisableStageTransitionInput.description: Represents the input of a DisableStageTransition action.

pipelineName.description: The name of the pipeline in which you want to disable the flow of artifacts from one stage to another.

reason.description: The reason given to the user why a stage is disabled, such as waiting for manual approval or manual tests. This message is displayed in the pipeline console UI.

stageName.description: The name of the stage where you want to disable the inbound or outbound transition of artifacts.

transitionType.description: Specifies whether artifacts will be prevented from transitioning into the stage and being processed by the actions in that stage (inbound), or prevented from transitioning from the stage after they have been processed by the actions in that stage (outbound).

DisableStageTransitionInput.title: DisableStageTransitionInput

EnableStageTransitionInput.description: Represents the input of an EnableStageTransition action.

pipelineName.description: The name of the pipeline in which you want to enable the flow of artifacts from one stage to another.

stageName.description: The name of the stage where you want to enable the transition of artifacts, either into the stage (inbound) or from that stage to the next stage (outbound).

transitionType.description: Specifies whether artifacts will be allowed to enter the stage and be processed by the actions in that stage (inbound) or whether already-processed artifacts will be allowed to transition to the next stage (outbound).

EnableStageTransitionInput.title: EnableStageTransitionInput

EncryptionKey.description: Represents information about the key used to encrypt data in the artifact store, such as an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key.

id.description: The ID used to identify the key. For an AWS KMS key, this is the key ID or key ARN.

type.description: The type of encryption key, such as an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key. When creating or updating a pipeline, the value must be set to 'KMS'.

EncryptionKey.title: EncryptionKey

ErrorDetails.description: Represents information about an error in AWS CodePipeline.

code.description: The system ID or error number code of the error.

message.description: The text of the error message.

ErrorDetails.title: ErrorDetails

ExecutionDetails.description: The details of the actions taken and results produced on an artifact as it passes through stages in the pipeline.

externalExecutionId.description: The system-generated unique ID of this action used to identify this job worker in any external systems, such as AWS CodeDeploy.

percentComplete.description: The percentage of work completed on the action, represented on a scale of zero to one hundred percent.

summary.description: The summary of the current status of the actions.

ExecutionDetails.title: ExecutionDetails

externalExecutionId.description: The external ID of the run of the action that failed.

GetJobDetailsInput.description: Represents the input of a GetJobDetails action.

jobId.description: The unique system-generated ID for the job.

GetJobDetailsInput.title: GetJobDetailsInput

GetJobDetailsOutput.description: Represents the output of a GetJobDetails action.

jobDetails.description:
The details of the job.

If AWSSessionCredentials is used, a long-running job can call GetJobDetails again to obtain new credentials.

GetJobDetailsOutput.title: GetJobDetailsOutput

GetPipelineExecutionInput.description: Represents the input of a GetPipelineExecution action.

pipelineExecutionId.description: The ID of the pipeline execution about which you want to get execution details.

pipelineName.description: The name of the pipeline about which you want to get execution details.

GetPipelineExecutionInput.title: GetPipelineExecutionInput

GetPipelineExecutionOutput.description: Represents the output of a GetPipelineExecution action.

pipelineExecution.description: Represents information about the execution of a pipeline.

GetPipelineExecutionOutput.title: GetPipelineExecutionOutput

GetPipelineInput.description: Represents the input of a GetPipeline action.

name.description: The name of the pipeline for which you want to get information. Pipeline names must be unique under an Amazon Web Services (AWS) user account.

version.description: The version number of the pipeline. If you do not specify a version, defaults to the most current version.

GetPipelineInput.title: GetPipelineInput

GetPipelineOutput.description: Represents the output of a GetPipeline action.

metadata.description: Represents the pipeline metadata information returned as part of the output of a GetPipeline action.

pipeline.description: Represents the structure of actions and stages to be performed in the pipeline.

GetPipelineOutput.title: GetPipelineOutput

GetPipelineStateInput.description: Represents the input of a GetPipelineState action.

name.description: The name of the pipeline about which you want to get information.

GetPipelineStateInput.title: GetPipelineStateInput

GetPipelineStateOutput.description: Represents the output of a GetPipelineState action.

created.description: The date and time the pipeline was created, in timestamp format.

pipelineName.description: The name of the pipeline for which you want to get the state.

pipelineVersion.description:
The version number of the pipeline.

A newly-created pipeline is always assigned a version number of 1.

stageStates.description: A list of the pipeline stage output information, including stage name, state, most recent run details, whether the stage is disabled, and other data.

updated.description: The date and time the pipeline was last updated, in timestamp format.

GetPipelineStateOutput.title: GetPipelineStateOutput

GetThirdPartyJobDetailsInput.description: Represents the input of a GetThirdPartyJobDetails action.

clientToken.description: The clientToken portion of the clientId and clientToken pair used to verify that the calling entity is allowed access to the job and its details.

jobId.description: The unique system-generated ID used for identifying the job.

GetThirdPartyJobDetailsInput.title: GetThirdPartyJobDetailsInput

GetThirdPartyJobDetailsOutput.description: Represents the output of a GetThirdPartyJobDetails action.

jobDetails.description: The details of the job, including any protected values defined for the job.

GetThirdPartyJobDetailsOutput.title: GetThirdPartyJobDetailsOutput

InputArtifact.description: Represents information about an artifact to be worked on, such as a test or build artifact.

name.description:
The name of the artifact to be worked on, for example, "My App".

The input artifact of an action must exactly match the output artifact declared in a preceding action, but the input artifact does not have to be the next action in strict sequence from the action that provided the output artifact. Actions in parallel can declare different output artifacts, which are in turn consumed by different following actions.

InputArtifact.title: InputArtifact

InvalidActionDeclarationException.description: The specified action declaration was specified in an invalid format.
InvalidActionDeclarationException.title: InvalidActionDeclarationException

InvalidApprovalTokenException.description: The approval request already received a response or has expired.
InvalidApprovalTokenException.title: InvalidApprovalTokenException

InvalidClientTokenException.description: The client token was specified in an invalid format
InvalidClientTokenException.title: InvalidClientTokenException

InvalidJobException.description: The specified job was specified in an invalid format or cannot be found.
InvalidJobException.title: InvalidJobException

InvalidJobStateException.description: The specified job state was specified in an invalid format.
InvalidJobStateException.title: InvalidJobStateException

InvalidNextTokenException.description: The next token was specified in an invalid format. Make sure that the next token you provided is the token returned by a previous call.
InvalidNextTokenException.title: InvalidNextTokenException

InvalidNonceException.description: The specified nonce was specified in an invalid format.
InvalidNonceException.title: InvalidNonceException

InvalidStageDeclarationException.description: The specified stage declaration was specified in an invalid format.
InvalidStageDeclarationException.title: InvalidStageDeclarationException

InvalidStructureException.description: The specified structure was specified in an invalid format.
InvalidStructureException.title: InvalidStructureException

accountId.description: The ID of the AWS account to use when performing the job.

id.description: The unique system-generated ID of the job.

nonce.description: A system-generated random number that AWS CodePipeline uses to ensure that the job is being worked on by only one job worker. Use this number in an AcknowledgeJob request.

JobData.description: Represents additional information about a job required for a job worker to complete the job.

actionConfiguration.description: Represents information about an action configuration.

actionTypeId.description: Represents information about an action type.

artifactCredentials.description: Represents an AWS session credentials object. These credentials are temporary credentials that are issued by AWS Secure Token Service (STS). They can be used to access input and output artifacts in the Amazon S3 bucket used to store artifact for the pipeline in AWS CodePipeline.

continuationToken.description: A system-generated token, such as a AWS CodeDeploy deployment ID, that a job requires in order to continue the job asynchronously.

encryptionKey.description: Represents information about the key used to encrypt data in the artifact store, such as an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key.

inputArtifacts.description: The artifact supplied to the job.

pipelineContext.description: Represents information about a pipeline to a job worker.

JobData.title: JobData

JobDetails.description: Represents information about the details of a job.

accountId.description: The AWS account ID associated with the job.

data.description: Represents additional information about a job required for a job worker to complete the job.

id.description: The unique system-generated ID of the job.

JobDetails.title: JobDetails

JobNotFoundException.description: The specified job was specified in an invalid format or cannot be found.
JobNotFoundException.title: JobNotFoundException

LimitExceededException.description: The number of pipelines associated with the AWS account has exceeded the limit allowed for the account.
LimitExceededException.title: LimitExceededException

ListActionTypesInput.description: Represents the input of a ListActionTypes action.

actionOwnerFilter.description: Filters the list of action types to those created by a specified entity.

nextToken.description: An identifier that was returned from the previous list action types call, which can be used to return the next set of action types in the list.

ListActionTypesInput.title: ListActionTypesInput

ListActionTypesOutput.description: Represents the output of a ListActionTypes action.

actionTypes.description: Provides details of the action types.

nextToken.description: If the amount of returned information is significantly large, an identifier is also returned which can be used in a subsequent list action types call to return the next set of action types in the list.

ListActionTypesOutput.title: ListActionTypesOutput

ListPipelineExecutionsInput.description: Represents the input of a ListPipelineExecutions action.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of results to return in a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value. The available pipeline execution history is limited to the most recent 12 months, based on pipeline execution start times. Default value is 100.

nextToken.description: The token that was returned from the previous ListPipelineExecutions call, which can be used to return the next set of pipeline executions in the list.

pipelineName.description: The name of the pipeline for which you want to get execution summary information.

ListPipelineExecutionsInput.title: ListPipelineExecutionsInput

ListPipelineExecutionsOutput.description: Represents the output of a ListPipelineExecutions action.

nextToken.description: A token that can be used in the next ListPipelineExecutions call. To view all items in the list, continue to call this operation with each subsequent token until no more nextToken values are returned.

pipelineExecutionSummaries.description: A list of executions in the history of a pipeline.

ListPipelineExecutionsOutput.title: ListPipelineExecutionsOutput

ListPipelinesInput.description: Represents the input of a ListPipelines action.

nextToken.description: An identifier that was returned from the previous list pipelines call, which can be used to return the next set of pipelines in the list.

ListPipelinesInput.title: ListPipelinesInput

ListPipelinesOutput.description: Represents the output of a ListPipelines action.

nextToken.description: If the amount of returned information is significantly large, an identifier is also returned which can be used in a subsequent list pipelines call to return the next set of pipelines in the list.

ListPipelinesOutput.title: ListPipelinesOutput

NotLatestPipelineExecutionException.description: The stage has failed in a later run of the pipeline and the pipelineExecutionId associated with the request is out of date.
NotLatestPipelineExecutionException.title: NotLatestPipelineExecutionException

OutputArtifact.description: Represents information about the output of an action.

name.description:
The name of the output of an artifact, such as "My App".

The input artifact of an action must exactly match the output artifact declared in a preceding action, but the input artifact does not have to be the next action in strict sequence from the action that provided the output artifact. Actions in parallel can declare different output artifacts, which are in turn consumed by different following actions.

Output artifact names must be unique within a pipeline.

OutputArtifact.title: OutputArtifact

PipelineContext.description: Represents information about a pipeline to a job worker.

action.description: The context of an action to a job worker within the stage of a pipeline.

pipelineName.description: The name of the pipeline. This is a user-specified value. Pipeline names must be unique across all pipeline names under an Amazon Web Services account.

PipelineContext.title: PipelineContext

PipelineDeclaration.description: Represents the structure of actions and stages to be performed in the pipeline.

artifactStore.description: Represents information about the Amazon S3 bucket where artifacts are stored for the pipeline.

name.description: The name of the action to be performed.

roleArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for AWS CodePipeline to use to either perform actions with no actionRoleArn, or to use to assume roles for actions with an actionRoleArn.

stages.description: The stage in which to perform the action.

version.description: The version number of the pipeline. A new pipeline always has a version number of 1. This number is automatically incremented when a pipeline is updated.

PipelineDeclaration.title: PipelineDeclaration

PipelineExecution.description: Represents information about an execution of a pipeline.

artifactRevisions.description: A list of ArtifactRevision objects included in a pipeline execution.

pipelineExecutionId.description: The ID of the pipeline execution.

pipelineName.description: The name of the pipeline that was executed.

pipelineVersion.description: The version number of the pipeline that was executed.

status.description:
The status of the pipeline execution.

  • InProgress: The pipeline execution is currently running.

  • Succeeded: The pipeline execution was completed successfully.

  • Superseded: While this pipeline execution was waiting for the next stage to be completed, a newer pipeline execution advanced and continued through the pipeline instead.

  • Failed: The pipeline execution was not completed successfully.

PipelineExecution.title: PipelineExecution

PipelineExecutionNotFoundException.description: The pipeline execution was specified in an invalid format or cannot be found, or an execution ID does not belong to the specified pipeline.
PipelineExecutionNotFoundException.title: PipelineExecutionNotFoundException

PipelineExecutionSummary.description: Summary information about a pipeline execution.

lastUpdateTime.description: The date and time of the last change to the pipeline execution, in timestamp format.

pipelineExecutionId.description: The ID of the pipeline execution.

startTime.description: The date and time when the pipeline execution began, in timestamp format.

status.description:
The status of the pipeline execution.

  • InProgress: The pipeline execution is currently running.

  • Succeeded: The pipeline execution was completed successfully.

  • Superseded: While this pipeline execution was waiting for the next stage to be completed, a newer pipeline execution advanced and continued through the pipeline instead.

  • Failed: The pipeline execution was not completed successfully.

PipelineExecutionSummary.title: PipelineExecutionSummary

created.description: The date and time the pipeline was created, in timestamp format.

pipelineArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the pipeline.

updated.description: The date and time the pipeline was last updated, in timestamp format.

PipelineNameInUseException.description: The specified pipeline name is already in use.
PipelineNameInUseException.title: PipelineNameInUseException

PipelineNotFoundException.description: The specified pipeline was specified in an invalid format or cannot be found.
PipelineNotFoundException.title: PipelineNotFoundException

PipelineSummary.description: Returns a summary of a pipeline.

created.description: The date and time the pipeline was created, in timestamp format.

updated.description: The date and time of the last update to the pipeline, in timestamp format.

version.description: The version number of the pipeline.

PipelineSummary.title: PipelineSummary

PipelineVersionNotFoundException.description: The specified pipeline version was specified in an invalid format or cannot be found.
PipelineVersionNotFoundException.title: PipelineVersionNotFoundException

PollForJobsInput.description: Represents the input of a PollForJobs action.

actionTypeId.description: Represents information about an action type.

maxBatchSize.description: The maximum number of jobs to return in a poll for jobs call.

queryParam.description: A map of property names and values. For an action type with no queryable properties, this value must be null or an empty map. For an action type with a queryable property, you must supply that property as a key in the map. Only jobs whose action configuration matches the mapped value will be returned.

PollForJobsInput.title: PollForJobsInput

PollForJobsOutput.description: Represents the output of a PollForJobs action.

jobs.description: Information about the jobs to take action on.

PollForJobsOutput.title: PollForJobsOutput

PollForThirdPartyJobsInput.description: Represents the input of a PollForThirdPartyJobs action.

actionTypeId.description: Represents information about an action type.

maxBatchSize.description: The maximum number of jobs to return in a poll for jobs call.

PollForThirdPartyJobsInput.title: PollForThirdPartyJobsInput

PollForThirdPartyJobsOutput.description: Represents the output of a PollForThirdPartyJobs action.

jobs.description: Information about the jobs to take action on.

PollForThirdPartyJobsOutput.title: PollForThirdPartyJobsOutput

PutActionRevisionInput.description: Represents the input of a PutActionRevision action.

actionName.description: The name of the action that will process the revision.

actionRevision.description: Represents information about the version (or revision) of an action.

pipelineName.description: The name of the pipeline that will start processing the revision to the source.

stageName.description: The name of the stage that contains the action that will act upon the revision.

PutActionRevisionInput.title: PutActionRevisionInput

PutActionRevisionOutput.description: Represents the output of a PutActionRevision action.

newRevision.description: Indicates whether the artifact revision was previously used in an execution of the specified pipeline.

pipelineExecutionId.description: The ID of the current workflow state of the pipeline.

PutActionRevisionOutput.title: PutActionRevisionOutput

PutApprovalResultInput.description: Represents the input of a PutApprovalResult action.

actionName.description: The name of the action for which approval is requested.

pipelineName.description: The name of the pipeline that contains the action.

result.description: Represents information about the result of the approval request.

stageName.description: The name of the stage that contains the action.

token.description: The system-generated token used to identify a unique approval request. The token for each open approval request can be obtained using the GetPipelineState action and is used to validate that the approval request corresponding to this token is still valid.

PutApprovalResultInput.title: PutApprovalResultInput

PutApprovalResultOutput.description: Represents the output of a PutApprovalResult action.

approvedAt.description: The timestamp showing when the approval or rejection was submitted.

PutApprovalResultOutput.title: PutApprovalResultOutput

PutJobFailureResultInput.description: Represents the input of a PutJobFailureResult action.

failureDetails.description: The details about the failure of a job.

jobId.description: The unique system-generated ID of the job that failed. This is the same ID returned from PollForJobs.

PutJobFailureResultInput.title: PutJobFailureResultInput

PutJobSuccessResultInput.description: Represents the input of a PutJobSuccessResult action.

continuationToken.description: A token generated by a job worker, such as an AWS CodeDeploy deployment ID, that a successful job provides to identify a custom action in progress. Future jobs will use this token in order to identify the running instance of the action. It can be reused to return additional information about the progress of the custom action. When the action is complete, no continuation token should be supplied.

currentRevision.description: The ID of the current revision of the artifact successfully worked upon by the job.

executionDetails.description: The execution details of the successful job, such as the actions taken by the job worker.

jobId.description: The unique system-generated ID of the job that succeeded. This is the same ID returned from PollForJobs.

PutJobSuccessResultInput.title: PutJobSuccessResultInput

PutThirdPartyJobFailureResultInput.description: Represents the input of a PutThirdPartyJobFailureResult action.

clientToken.description: The clientToken portion of the clientId and clientToken pair used to verify that the calling entity is allowed access to the job and its details.

jobId.description: The ID of the job that failed. This is the same ID returned from PollForThirdPartyJobs.

PutThirdPartyJobFailureResultInput.title: PutThirdPartyJobFailureResultInput

PutThirdPartyJobSuccessResultInput.description: Represents the input of a PutThirdPartyJobSuccessResult action.

clientToken.description: The clientToken portion of the clientId and clientToken pair used to verify that the calling entity is allowed access to the job and its details.

continuationToken.description: A token generated by a job worker, such as an AWS CodeDeploy deployment ID, that a successful job provides to identify a partner action in progress. Future jobs will use this token in order to identify the running instance of the action. It can be reused to return additional information about the progress of the partner action. When the action is complete, no continuation token should be supplied.

currentRevision.description: Represents information about a current revision.

executionDetails.description: The details of the actions taken and results produced on an artifact as it passes through stages in the pipeline.

jobId.description: The ID of the job that successfully completed. This is the same ID returned from PollForThirdPartyJobs.

PutThirdPartyJobSuccessResultInput.title: PutThirdPartyJobSuccessResultInput

RetryStageExecutionInput.description: Represents the input of a RetryStageExecution action.

pipelineExecutionId.description: The ID of the pipeline execution in the failed stage to be retried. Use the GetPipelineState action to retrieve the current pipelineExecutionId of the failed stage

pipelineName.description: The name of the pipeline that contains the failed stage.

retryMode.description: The scope of the retry attempt. Currently, the only supported value is FAILED_ACTIONS.

stageName.description: The name of the failed stage to be retried.

RetryStageExecutionInput.title: RetryStageExecutionInput

RetryStageExecutionOutput.description: Represents the output of a RetryStageExecution action.

pipelineExecutionId.description: The ID of the current workflow execution in the failed stage.

RetryStageExecutionOutput.title: RetryStageExecutionOutput

S3ArtifactLocation.description: The location of the Amazon S3 bucket that contains a revision.

bucketName.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket.

objectKey.description: The key of the object in the Amazon S3 bucket, which uniquely identifies the object in the bucket.

S3ArtifactLocation.title: S3ArtifactLocation

StageContext.description: Represents information about a stage to a job worker.
StageContext.title: StageContext

StageDeclaration.description: Represents information about a stage and its definition.

actions.description: The actions included in a stage.

StageDeclaration.title: StageDeclaration

StageExecution.description: Represents information about the run of a stage.

pipelineExecutionId.description: The ID of the pipeline execution associated with the stage.

status.description: The status of the stage, or for a completed stage, the last status of the stage.

StageExecution.title: StageExecution

StageNotFoundException.description: The specified stage was specified in an invalid format or cannot be found.
StageNotFoundException.title: StageNotFoundException

StageNotRetryableException.description: The specified stage can't be retried because the pipeline structure or stage state changed after the stage was not completed; the stage contains no failed actions; one or more actions are still in progress; or another retry attempt is already in progress.
StageNotRetryableException.title: StageNotRetryableException

StageState.description: Represents information about the state of the stage.

inboundTransitionState.description: The state of the inbound transition, which is either enabled or disabled.

latestExecution.description: Information about the latest execution in the stage, including its ID and status.

StageState.title: StageState

StartPipelineExecutionInput.description: Represents the input of a StartPipelineExecution action.

name.description: The name of the pipeline to start.

StartPipelineExecutionInput.title: StartPipelineExecutionInput

StartPipelineExecutionOutput.description: Represents the output of a StartPipelineExecution action.

pipelineExecutionId.description: The unique system-generated ID of the pipeline execution that was started.

StartPipelineExecutionOutput.title: StartPipelineExecutionOutput

ThirdPartyJob.description: A response to a PollForThirdPartyJobs request returned by AWS CodePipeline when there is a job to be worked upon by a partner action.

clientId.description: The clientToken portion of the clientId and clientToken pair used to verify that the calling entity is allowed access to the job and its details.

jobId.description: The identifier used to identify the job in AWS CodePipeline.

ThirdPartyJob.title: ThirdPartyJob

ThirdPartyJobData.description: Represents information about the job data for a partner action.

actionConfiguration.description: Represents information about an action configuration.

actionTypeId.description: Represents information about an action type.

artifactCredentials.description: Represents an AWS session credentials object. These credentials are temporary credentials that are issued by AWS Secure Token Service (STS). They can be used to access input and output artifacts in the Amazon S3 bucket used to store artifact for the pipeline in AWS CodePipeline.

continuationToken.description: A system-generated token, such as a AWS CodeDeploy deployment ID, that a job requires in order to continue the job asynchronously.

encryptionKey.description: The encryption key used to encrypt and decrypt data in the artifact store for the pipeline, such as an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key. This is optional and might not be present.

inputArtifacts.description: The name of the artifact that will be worked upon by the action, if any. This name might be system-generated, such as "MyApp", or might be defined by the user when the action is created. The input artifact name must match the name of an output artifact generated by an action in an earlier action or stage of the pipeline.

outputArtifacts.description: The name of the artifact that will be the result of the action, if any. This name might be system-generated, such as "MyBuiltApp", or might be defined by the user when the action is created.

pipelineContext.description: Represents information about a pipeline to a job worker.

ThirdPartyJobData.title: ThirdPartyJobData

ThirdPartyJobDetails.description: The details of a job sent in response to a GetThirdPartyJobDetails request.

data.description: The data to be returned by the third party job worker.

id.description: The identifier used to identify the job details in AWS CodePipeline.

nonce.description: A system-generated random number that AWS CodePipeline uses to ensure that the job is being worked on by only one job worker. Use this number in an AcknowledgeThirdPartyJob request.

ThirdPartyJobDetails.title: ThirdPartyJobDetails

TransitionState.description: Represents information about the state of transitions between one stage and another stage.

disabledReason.description: The user-specified reason why the transition between two stages of a pipeline was disabled.

enabled.description: Whether the transition between stages is enabled (true) or disabled (false).

lastChangedAt.description: The timestamp when the transition state was last changed.

lastChangedBy.description: The ID of the user who last changed the transition state.

TransitionState.title: TransitionState

UpdatePipelineInput.description: Represents the input of an UpdatePipeline action.

pipeline.description: The name of the pipeline to be updated.

UpdatePipelineInput.title: UpdatePipelineInput

UpdatePipelineOutput.description: Represents the output of an UpdatePipeline action.

pipeline.description: The structure of the updated pipeline.

UpdatePipelineOutput.title: UpdatePipelineOutput

ValidationException.description: The validation was specified in an invalid format.
ValidationException.title: ValidationException
